page.title: 13The Gayton village magazine
page.content: The local magazine of Gayton is run by two ladies, living just outside the village. We asked them why they started the "Gayton News". "Living out of the village along the Tiffield Road my neighbour and I decided that we were often last to hear about activities in the village especially during the winter months when we may not venture out for a week or more - so in October 1982, "Gayton News" was born. We decided that "Gayton News" should be sold to raise funds for the village hall and inform everyone of events and also entertain. We hoped also to hear from all the committees or clubs in the village. We hoped that anyone moving to the village would be able to find out what Gayton had to offer. For the first year we invited subscribers to pay in advance - the circulation is now 175 copies."
